summary: the aim of the study was to document the incidence of respiratory virus infections in critically ill adult patients admitted to the ICU. the most frequently found virus was influenza (37%), followed by RSV (15%), rhinovirus (15%), MPV (15%), corona virus (9%) and parainfluenza virus (9%). in comparison with PCR-positive patients (11 (6 to 20) vs. 7 (2 to 8) days respectively, respectively, P30.05.
